intro: Euryops euryopoides, commonly known as the golden bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Euryops euryopoides is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
